citation.article-title: Lactobacillus harbinensis sp. nov., consisted of strains isolated from traditional fermented vegetables 'Suan cai' in Harbin, Northeastern China and Lactobacillus perolens DSM 12745.

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus harbinensis sp. nov.
L. harbinensis (har.bi.nen'sis. N.L. masc./fem. adj. harbinensis pertaining to Harbin, a city in northeastern China where traditional fermented vegetables are prepared and consumed).
Lactobacillus harbinensis Miyamoto, Seto, Hao, Teshima, Sun, Kabuki, Yao and Nakajima sp. nov.
Cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming rods, average size of 0.5×2.5 μm, catalase-negative, non-motile.
Acid is produced from d- to l-arabinose.
The organism can grow between 20 to 45 °C with optimum growth at 37 °C.
DNA G+C content of L. harbinensis is 53–54 mol%.
Habitat: isolated from fermented vegetables, brewery environment, and from spoiled soft drinks.
The type strain is DSM 16991T (= AHU1762T=SBT10908T).
The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number of 16S rDNA of strain DSM 16991 (=SBT10908) is AB196123 and SBT 10904 is AB194126.
